alert.note: Alert for Roosevelt (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 8:49PM MDT until April 15 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Montana... Poplar River Near Poplar affecting Roosevelt County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Poplar River Near Poplar. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Low lying areas near gage site begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM MDT Friday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM MDT Friday was 17.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 12.4 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.2 feet on 07/22/1993. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 1200 PM MDT.
